thread.title: Atletico Madrid defender Jose Gimenez 'keen on Manchester United transfer' this summer
thread.title_full: Atletico Madrid defender Jose Gimenez 'keen on Manchester United transfer' this summer

author: Samuel Luckhurst
title: Atletico Madrid defender Jose Gimenez 'keen on Manchester United transfer' this summer
text:
Sport Atletico Madrid defender Jose Gimenez 'keen on Manchester United transfer' this summer The Atletico defender has been sounded out by United in the past and it appears that he could be interested in the move Share Gimenez would reportedly welcome a switch to United this summer (Photo: Bongarts) Share Get Manchester United FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Jose Gimenez is keen on a transfer to Manchester United this summer. 
The Manchester Evening News report that the Atletico Madrid defender was considered by United as a January purchase along with Benfica's Victor Lindelof. 
Although Atletico are renowned for their stout defending Gimenez has started just 16 games this season as Diego Simeone has retained the Champions League final partnership of Diego Godín and Stefan Savic. 
Gimenez's contract expires next summer but it features a £56million buyout clause United would be reluctant to pay, given the Uruguay international would have just a year left on his deal. 
United are expected to reinforce their central defence in the summer having bought Eric Bailly from Villarreal last year for £30m. United are believed to have sounded out a move for Gimenez Victor Lindelof was also considered for a move in January (Photo: Getty Images Europe) 
Marcos Rojo has performed well at centre half and Phil Jones enjoyed a purple patch in the winter but suffered his fourth injury of the campaign last week and fellow England international Chris Smalling's fitness remains an issue. 
Mourinho insisted last month he had specifically told United executive vice-chairman Ed Woodward which players he wanted to sign. 
"I know the players I want," he said. "Of course at the start it is about the quality of the players we want but sooner or later it has to end in the players we want. The form of Phil Jones and Marcos Rojo convinced United not to sign replacements (Photo: AFP) Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
